results.name: Pendular triangle (p=0), read by rows, where row n is formed from row n-1 by the recurrence: if n > 2k, T(n,k) = T(n,n-k) + T(n-1,k), otherwise T(n,k) = T(n,n-1-k) + p*T(n-1,k), for n >= k <= 0, with T(n,0) = 1 and T(n,n) = 0^n.
comment: See A118340 for definition of pendular triangles and pendular sums.
The last five rows in the example section appear in the table on p. 8 of Getzler. Cf. also A173075. - _Tom Copeland_, Jan 22 2020
link: G. C. Greubel, Rows n = 0..100 of the triangle, flattened
E. Getzler, The semi-classical approximation for modular operads, arXiv:alg-geom/9612005, 1996.
formula: T(2n+m) = [A001764^(m+1)](n), i.e., the m-th lower semi-diagonal forms the self-convolution (m+1)-power of A001764.
If n > 2k, T(n,k) = binomial(n+k+1,k)*(n-2k+1)/(n+k+1), else T(n,k) = T(n,n-1-k), with conditions: T(n,0)=1 for n>=0 and T(n,n)=0 for n > 0. - _Paul D. Hanna_, Nov 12 2009
program: else: return T(n, n-k-1, p) + p*T(n-1, k, p)
flatten([[T(n, k, 0) for k in (0..n)] for n in (0..12)]) # _G. C. Greubel_, Feb 17 2021
if k lt 0 or n lt k then return 0;
elif k eq n then return 0;
elif n gt 2*k then return T(n,n-k,p) + T(n-1,k,p);
